revised_title: Observations of a Comet by Nicolas Munckley
tldr: Nicolas Munckley observed a comet in the sky near the constellation of Orion. The comet appeared dimmer and larger than stars and had a faint, ill-defined haziness. It seemed to move towards the north-west. Munckley observed it on January 9, 1760, but could not see it after the 13th due to cloudy weather.
